The Exception

Kevin,

Was the faces config file part of a JSF faceted project?  It is not currently possible to use the editor without this dependency.

Can you confirm that this a dupe of https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=150120?

Thanks,
GK

Yes, it appears to be the same issue. I was just starting to build a JSF within an already defined project that has been enabled for web development and deployment (if that's what you mean by facet). I use MyEclipse5 for my J2EE development. Typically I create a simple Java project first so I can code POJO's. Then when I need to add additional funcionality, I add in a "nature" or turn on an "environment" (perhaps this is what you mean by facet). I had just added in the JSF capability, and was attempting to edit the faced-config.xml file. I normally just double click to open files in Package Explorer although I do know that I can right click to get a menu of available editors. I must say, however, even when I pull up the menu of available editors, the short text is not enough to have a clue about what I'm getting. While what I'm about to say is an enhancement, it would be nice if in the right-click pop up menu, there was at least an annotation that told me what each element was for.



*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 150120 ***
Closing as part of mass query to clean up old resolved bugs in untargetted milestones.
